fluff.name: Luchador
entries: Ehre, Familie, Tradition. Das ist der Weg des Luchadors. F√ºr sie ist die Welt nur ein weiterer Ring, in dem sie ihren Triumph ausrufen k√∂nnen. Vom rechtschaffenen Helden, dessen blo√üe Anwesenheit eine Welle des Jubels und der Zuversicht ausl√∂st, bis hin zu den dunkleren Pfaden oder Rudos der Lucha-Welt, die mit allen Mitteln beweisen wollen, dass sie die Besten sind. Unabh√§ngig vom eingeschlagenen Weg bleibt f√ºr den Luchador eines immer das Wichtigste: ein guter Kampf und der Wunsch, El Rey del Ring (K√∂nig des Rings) zu werden.

entries.name: Races
entries: Universell, es ist eine Lebensweise, und als solche sind alle Arten von Wesen Luchadors gewesen. Es ist zwar selten, dass eher aquatische Rassen wie das Meervolk zu Luchadoren werden, aber es ist nicht unerh√∂rt. Obwohl sie normalerweise aus einer Lucha-Familienlinie stammen und einfach die Familientradition fortsetzen, gab es Zeiten, in denen Jugendliche, die von dem Spektakel geblendet waren, ihr normales Leben aufgaben, um sich dem Leben der Lucha anzuschlie√üen, oder sogar Menschen, die eine Vision sahen und sich der Linie anpassten.

entries.name: Group Dynamics
entries: Luchadore k√∂nnen in alle Spektren der Ausrichtung und auch in Parteien fallen. Gute Luchadors oder T√©cnicos sind in der Lage, mit jedem umzugehen, auch wenn ihr st√§ndiges Streben nach Aufmerksamkeit und ihre Kampfschreie der Ehre bekannterma√üen an den Nerven der Parteimitglieder nagen. Doch wenn es hart auf hart kommt und Leben auf dem Spiel stehen, egal ob es sich um den besten Freund oder den verhassten Bekannten handelt, sind diese Luchadors die ersten, die sich ins Get√ºmmel st√ºrzen und sie besch√ºtzen. F√ºr die T√©cnicos ist die Party ihre Familie und nichts kommt vor ihr. Auf der anderen Seite stehen die b√∂sen Luchadors oder Rudos. F√ºr sie ist jeder eine Herausforderung, die darauf wartet, besiegt zu werden, und sie neigen dazu, sich mit anderen zu verb√ºnden, um entweder mit ihrer St√§rke zu prahlen oder als Sprungbrett zu dienen, um den n√§chsten gro√üen Herausforderer zu finden. Sie sind zwar nicht durch und durch b√∂sartig, aber sie z√∂gern nicht, auf Verb√ºndete zu verzichten, um sich als die Besten zu beweisen und dem El Rey del Ring einen Schritt n√§her zu kommen.

entries.name: Alignment Restrictions

items: {@b {@i Honor above all other things, any act that would seen as dishonorable to your mask or your title is forbidden.}}
{@b {@i Robbing from the weaker is forbidden.}}
{@b {@i Attacking without first issuing a challenge or in cold blood is forbidden unless attacked first.}}

entries: Wenn einer dieser Grunds√§tze gebrochen wird, wird der Luchador zum Ex-Luchador, bis er seine Ehre mit den Mitteln wiederherstellen kann, die seine pers√∂nliche Ehre f√ºr notwendig h√§lt; erkundige dich bei deinem DM, was darunter f√§llt.

entries.name: Ex Luchadore

Sie verlieren den Zugang zu allen Luchador-Bewegungen und -F√§higkeiten, abgesehen von ihrer Luchador-Bewegung ohne R√ºstung, ihrer Verteidigung ohne R√ºstung, ihrem Verbesserten Kampf-Greifer und ihrem Unbewaffneten K√∂nner, und werden zu einem M√∂nch der gleichen Stufe ohne Zugang zu einer monastischen Tradition, Zugang zu Ki oder exklusiven M√∂nchsf√§higkeiten.

classFeature.name: Protect the Mask

classFeature.name: Unarmed Savant

classFeature.name: Improved Combat Grappler

items: Nach einem erfolgreichen {@action Grapple|phb|grapple} kannst du versuchen, deinen Gegner als Bonusaktion festzunageln, um den {@condition restrained}-Effekt auf ihn anzuwenden; dies wird durch eine weitere {@action Grapple|phb|grapple}-√úberpr√ºfung bestimmt. classFeature.name: Inspired Wrestler

classFeature.name: Way of Lucha
entries: Auf Stufe 3 entscheidet sich der Luchador f√ºr einen Lucha-Pfad. Er kann ein T√©cnico, Rudo oder Esp√≠ritu werden. T√©cnicos verlassen sich weniger auf Tricks und T√§uschung, sondern ziehen ihre St√§rke aus der Verbundenheit ihrer Verb√ºndeten und aus hochfliegenden akrobatischen Bewegungen, um im Kampf zu bestehen. W√§hrend alle Luchador mit ihren Vorfahren und den Kreaturen ihrer Maske in Verbindung stehen, geht der Esp√≠ritu noch einen Schritt weiter. Alle Angriffe auf Ziele, die nicht du selbst bist, werden mit Nachteil ausgef√ºhrt; dieser Nachteil gilt nicht, wenn der Zauber nat√ºrlich mehrere Ziele treffen kann. classFeature.name: Bonds of the Luchador
entries: Ob ein Rudo, T√©cnicos oder Esp√≠ritu Luchador, der Luchador versteht und ehrt die Traditionen der Familie auf die eine oder andere Weise und erh√§lt, abh√§ngig von seinem Weg des Lucha auf Stufe 9, einen von drei Segen, wenn er sich in der N√§he von Verb√ºndeten befindet:

Wenn ein Verb√ºndeter im Umkreis von f√ºnf Fu√ü von einem Gegner im Nahkampf angegriffen wird, darfst du als Reaktion einen waffenlosen Angriff gegen deinen Feind ausf√ºhren, um ihn in die Irre zu f√ºhren.

classFeature.name: Ring Fighter

items: Alle magischen oder anderen Mittel, die den Luchador sofort au√üer Gefecht setzen, haben eine h√∂here Chance zu scheitern. Wenn du einen DC schlagen musst, w√ºrfelst du mit Vorteil, und jeder Zauber, der zu deiner Ausschaltung eingesetzt wird, wird mit Nachteil gew√ºrfelt.

Der Luchador kann diese F√§higkeit erst wieder einsetzen, wenn er eine lange Pause beendet hat.

classFeature.name: Dios de Lucha (God of Lucha)
entries: At 20th level, the Luchador has attained the title of El Rey del Ring, but, it isn't enough anymore. The beings of the natural material plane can no longer sate the thirst for battle within the Luchador, they need more to prove that the way of the Lucha is truly the way. The Luchador's body no longer ages, nor do they need to sleep, eat, or drink staying at its prime at all times in attempt to find stronger opponents to fight. A short rest is all that is needed to gain back all Luchador abilities and die, even abilities that normally require long rest. Their mask becomes one with the Luchador, no longer being able to be removed. At this point, the Luchador can grapple any and all creatures of any size, or form, with advantage.

subclassFeature.name: Way of T√©cnicos
entries: The people's hero. These are the Luchadors that strive to not just better themselves for themselves but strive to show the people that anything can be achieved, through hard work and determination. While they might boast and fight, they remember their roots and work to raise confidence in all folk. At times, they become folk heroes, riding into towns and using their prowess to overtake corruption through Lucha, then leaving before they can be rewarded, all in the sake of justice. T√©cnicos fight for El Rey del Ring but use clean high flying spectacle moves and provoke their allies to success through their own personal strength.

subclassFeature.name: Lucha Libre
entries: At 3rd level, a T√©cnicos style of wrestler prides themselves in their speed and agility, and heavily prefer the air over the ground. The T√©cnicos' prowess in such aerial fields allows them to instead use their Dexterity modifier instead of Strength when jumping and making jump attempts. While unarmored, you have the ability to become airborne after performing a long jump or high jump, except you only have to move at least 5 feet before making the jump. When you make a high jump, you leap into the air a number of feet equal to 5 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier if you move at least 5 feet on foot immediately before the jump. When you make a standing high jump, you can jump the full distance. When you make a long jump, you cover a number of feet up to your Strength or Dexterity score if you move at least 5 feet on foot immediately before the jump. When you make a standing long jump, you can leap the full distance. Either way, each foot you clear on the jump costs a foot of movement. This can only be done if you are wearing no armor. If your airborne movement would land on an opponent, with a size equal or larger than yours, you take no fall damage and can make a {@action Grapple|phb|grapple} check as a bonus action. Furthermore, when attempting to vault off a {@condition grappled} enemy, ally or inanimate object to become airborne, you may roll an {@skill Acrobatics}/{@skill Athletics} check, with advantage, allowing you to move a distance equal to your standing long jump distance. Attacks of opportunity against you are made at disadvantage when moving this way, unless they are attacking from directly beneath you.

subclassFeature.name: Crowd Favorite
entries: At 6th level, a T√©cnicos has gained appeal with their party and can bolster their resolve by striking up confidence within them. You gain proficiency in the {@skill Performance} skill, if you're already proficient, your proficiency bonus is doubled. As an action, you can give a speech or perform an act to inspire up to 6 allies within 10 feet, giving them advantage on their next attack roll, lasting until the end of their next turn. This can be used only once per short rest.

subclassFeature.name: The People's Resolve
entries: At 11th level, a T√©cnicos refusal to let down their allies allows him to forgo dying. When reduced to 0 hitpoints, you can make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a success, you instead drop to 1 hitpoint and negate any instant death effects. The DC for the saving throw increases by 5 each time it is repeated and resets after finishing a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Lucha Tag Team
entries: At 17th level, a T√©cnicos can either recruit an NPC or even an ally and instill their skills of Luchador in them, making them their Lucha Tag Team partner. While within 10 feet of each other, you both gain advantage on saving throws and melee weapon/unarmed attack rolls. Once per round, either of you may impose disadvantage on one attack roll against your partner. Your tag team partner can also aid you in executing your ultimate finishing move, imposing disadvantage on the opponents saving throw as a reaction. You may only change partners if your initial one dies and/or betrays you. (Up to DM's discretion whether you may have more allies.)

subclassFeature.name: Way of Rudo
entries: For the flip side of every coin, there is a darker side that embodies another face of it. For every T√©cnicos, there is a Rudo. They care little for the rules and barely stay inside them enough to fight and respect the code of Lucha. They will seemingly change sides on a whim, use weapons and fear tactics to force people to submit to their will and power, all to become El Rey del Ring.

subclassFeature.name: Dirty Brawler
entries: To a Rudo, victory will be gained by any means, whether it be through guile and cheating or just being dirty handed, the ends justify the means in a fight. At Level 3, you gain the ability to use all objects around you as a weapon, be it chairs, thumbtacks, trash cans, or even a bag of salt.

items: You are proficient with all improvised weapons, the damage die is {@dice 1d4} for a throwing weapon, {@dice 1d6} if a one-handed melee weapon, or {@dice 1d12} if a two-handed melee weapon. Any melee attack made with an improvised weapon may use your Unarmed Savant damage die instead.
You are proficient with {@skill Sleight of Hand}, when making an ability check to conceal an improvised weapon, or plant on an opponent.

As a bonus action, you can insult an opponent within 30 feet to throw off their focus. The target of this insult must succeed on an Intelligence saving throw or have disadvantage on their first attack roll against you on their turn. Also, the insulted opponent becomes more vulnerable to your strikes. For 1 minute, you add your proficiency bonus to improvised weapon damage against the insulted opponent. Only one opponent can be under the effects of your insult during combat.

subclassFeature.name: Fearful Appearance
entries: Your very visage strikes dread into people and enemies as stories of your malicious tales spread through the world. Your very name is only whispered in fear that you will be summoned by its call. At 6th level, you gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill, if you're already proficient, your proficiency bonus is doubled. Every round, you may attempt to strike fear into an opponent, not immune to fear, within 30 feet of you as an action. The opponent must make a Wisdom saving throw equal or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. Creatures one size larger then you ignore your proficiency bonus to the save DC, while creatures two size larger than you ignore the effect. Creatures {@condition frightened} by you may attempt the saving throw again, at the end of their turns.

subclassFeature.name: Vaya con Dios
entries: Your ruthlessness knows no bounds and as such, your mask grants you forbidden knowledge, the art of destroying an opponent's very soul with one deadly strike, Vaya con Dios. At 11th level, you can as an action expend 3 Inspiration dice to target an opponent within your melee range that is {@condition frightened} by you, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition stunned}, or {@condition unconscious}. Enemies that are {@condition frightened} must also be {@condition restrained}. Enemies with 0 hitpoints cannot avoid this effect. {@condition Paralyzed}, {@condition stunned}, sleeping, or {@condition frightened} enemies make a Constitution saving throw equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength/Dexterity modifier. On a failure, the target instantly dies, a {@condition frightened} targets drop to 0 hitpoints. You may also expend your Ultimate Finishing Move instead to attempt Vaya con Dios again. Once successfully executed, you cannot perform Vaya con Dios again, until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Avatar of Treachery
entries: At level 17, you are imbued with the ancient power of your Luchador Rudo line, you and your mask become the harbinger of all Rudos that have come before you. As an action, you can surround yourself in a 10 foot radius sphere of shadow for 1 minute, turning all bright light in its area into dim light. The shadows cloud all vision other than yours, negating the benefits of {@sense darkvision}, but not {@sense truesight}. You have three-quarters cover within the sphere and ranged attacks against you are made with disadvantage. All creatures that enter, or end their turn in the aura must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, enemies take {@condition 2d10} psychic damage and become {@condition frightened}, or only half damage on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Way of Esp√≠ritu Luchador
entries: Where the T√©cnicos use high flying acrobatics and Rudo use underhandedness, the Esp√≠ritu Luchador or Spirit Wrestler relies more on the spirits of their ancestors and of their mask to gain power and strength. All Luchadors hold an affinity to the spirit world, but none more so then the Esp√≠ritu Luchador. They may call on the spirit of their mask to gain animal-like power, or their ancestors to channel their own hidden and special moves.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit of the Mask
entries: At 3rd level, the Luchador can passively channel an aspect of an animal. You gain additional Inspiration dice, equal to your Constitution modifier and once per combat, during any action, you may expend an Inspiration die to gain the benefits of a Spirit Form for 1 minute, selecting one of the following aspects:

items: If a marine animal, your swim speed becomes equal to your movement and all combat while in the water incurs no disadvantage. While underwater, all melee attacks by enemies not adept to water are made with disadvantage. Also, you can expend an additional Inspiration dice to reduce one attack roll against you equal to the dice roll. This can be used after the attack is rolled, but not after the damage result.

If an avian creature, your long and high jump distance are increased to 15 feet and do not require movement to be done. You no longer take fall damage from a drop of 20 feet, unless forced by an enemy. If you take any fall damage, you can expend an Inspiration dice to reduce the damage by 5 times the dice roll.

If an agile land creature, You can {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Dodge} as a bonus action, as well as have advantage on Dexterity checks. When making a saving throw, you can expend an Inspiration dice to add to the roll. No damage is taken if successful.

If a strong land creature, you have advantage on any strength checks and strength saving throws, and you are considered one size larger for the purpose of grappling, pushing, pulling and lifting. Your unarmed strikes gain the Siege ability and deal an extra {@dice 1d4} damage. When pinning an opponent, you can expend an Inspiration dice to deal damage equal to double the dice roll.

subclassFeature.name: Ancestral Ward
entries: Through extensive meditation, the Esp√≠ritu has bonded with their ancestors, who vow to protect their harbinger, to ensure they stay true to their Lucha code. At Luchador level 6, you have advantage on saving throws against {@condition charmed|phb|charms}, magical {@condition blinded|phb|blindness}, {@condition incapacitated|phb|incapacitation}, {@condition paralyzed|phb|paralysis}, {@condition petrified|phb|petrification}, {@condition poisoned|phb|poison}, {@condition stunned|phb|stun} and magically applied {@condition unconscious|phb|unconsciousness}. In addition, you gain resistance to psychic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Del Luchador Salvador
entries: At 11th level, your ancestral lines vow of protection extends even to the grip of death. When you drop to 0 hitpoints, you may expend all your remaining Inspiration dice to regain 10 hitpoints for every dice expended.

subclassFeature.name: Harmonic Convergence
entries: At 17th level, the Esp√≠ritu has reached Lucha enlightenment and become one with his ancestor's spirits. Changing into your Spirit of the Mask form no longer expends an Inspiration Dice. You may change your spirit form during any of your actions at the cost of an Inspiration Dice. When you change into your spirit form or change forms, you may combine 2 aspects instead of 1. Also, at the start of any combat phase, you always start with a minimum number of Inspiration dice equal to your Constitution modifier.
